rss.channel:
Robin and Josie's Utter Shambles http://www.comedycentral.co.uk/podcasts en-us Copyright The Paramount UK Partnership trading as Comedy Central 2010. All Rights Reserved. With Robin Ince, Josie Long and guests Comedy Central Robin and Josie's Utter Shambles is a Comedy Central podcast series hosted by broadcaster and comedians Robin Ince and Josie Long. For extended versions of the latest episodes and more information, including pictures and links, visit www.comedycentral.co.uk/podcasts.
WARNING: Robin and Josie's Utter Shambles contains very strong language and adult discussion that some listeners may find offensive.
Robin Ince, Josie Long and guests discuss comedy, religion, Twitter, Facebook, science, evolution and comedy. - Comedy Central adrian.mackinder@comedycentral.co.uk

Episode 1: Alan Moore Comedy Central Robin, Josie and legendary comics writer Alan Moore discuss conspiracy theories, the Royal Family, knitted cakes and the importance of having a jumper during an apocalypse. Episode 2: Ed Byrne Comedy Central Irish comedian Ed Byrne talks candidly about his much-publicised Twitter skirmish with professional joke-thief Keith Chegwin. Find out what’s its like living with Ross Noble, Josie finally joins the 21st century by getting herself an iPhone and discover why the survivors of all horror movies are still screwed. Episode 3: Ben Goldacre Comedy Central This week Robin and Josie are joined by real-life medical doctor and controversial author and writer of The Guardian’s ‘Bad Science’ column, Ben Goldacre. Expect flabby testicles, the ‘benefits’ of vitamin pills and why Josie feels the need to start scribbling on escalators again... Episode 6: Phill Jupitus Comedy Central Something different this week. Josie's on tour, so her dainty shoes have been filled for one week only by professional angry man Michael Legge, while guest duties taken up by Phill Jupitus and musician Darren Hayman. Expect tales of Essex, past musical glories and John Peel. Something different this week. Episode 8: Mark Gatiss Comedy Central The last podcast of the series is something of a Halloween special as Robin and Josie are joined by former League of Gentlemen star, writer, actor and horror aficionado Mark Gatiss. Fresh from his excellent BBC series A History of Horror, Mark discusses writing Sherlock, Doctor Who and all things that go bump in the night. Episode 9: Andrew Collins and Richard Herring Comedy Central Utter Shambles returns with another special: When Podcasts Attack! This week 'proper' podcasters Richard Herring and Andrew Collins show Robin and Josie how it's done. along the way they ponder their own mortality after Josie's – on a high after her Loaded LAFTA nomination - recent near-death experience, while the conversation hurtles swiftly onto Harvey Keitel's 'winky' and why Collins had such a terrible time at his friend's dad's pig farm. Episode 12: Billy Bragg Comedy Central Robin and Josie are back from Edinburgh and they’ve snared the musician, activist and all-round lovely man Billy Bragg Billy Bragg discusses his karaoke songs of choice, demonstrates his superior of American prison knowledge and reveals how a mushroom biryani led to John Peel playing his first record on Radio 1

Episode 13: Scroobius Pip Comedy Central The lyrically dextrous Scroobius Pip joins Robin Ince and Josie Long for a brand new edition of Utter Shambles. Episode 14: Terry Jones Comedy Central In an Utter Shambles first, Robin and Josie go AWOL and chat to Monty Python legend Terry Jones in his own home. Episode 15: Tim Minchin Comedy Central Tim Minchin joins Robin and Josie and ends up talking liquorice, Jedward and playing the Royal Albert Hall. In this edition of Utter Shambles Tim Minchin finds himself treading random topics including pipe smoking, the history of liquorice, Josie's Jedward obsession and what it’s like to play to audiences in the Royal Albert Hall.

Episode 17: Mark Gatiss and Alan Moore Comedy Central A Christmas gift from Robin and Josie: Alan Moore and Mark Gatiss in the same room together! Mark Gatiss and Alan Moore join Robin and Josie for a Christmas special of Utter Shambles. Festive chatter includes what's on the telly this Christmas, why Alan won't be joining the digital age any time soon and why the Frozen Planet polar bear furore makes Mark 'incandescant with rage'. Merry Christmas!

Episode 18: Richard Herring, Isy Suttie and Danielle Ward Comedy Central Robin and Josie return with an Edinburgh Fringe special starring Richard Herring, Isy Suttie and Danielle Ward. As the 2012 Edinburgh Festival gets under way, Richard Herring, Isy Suttie and Danielle Ward join Robin and Josie to talk the highs and lows of life at the Fringe, the helpfulness of reviews and memories of festivals past. To download an extended version of this podcast head over to http://www.comedycentral.co.uk/podcasts

Episode 19: Rufus Hound Comedy Central It’s the turn of comedian and actor Rufus Hound to join Robin Ince and Josie Long as a guest this month for another brand new Utter Shambles. It’s the turn of comedian and actor Rufus Hound to join Robin Ince and Josie Long as a guest this month for another brand new Utter Shambles. As usual the conversation veers off to unexpected heights of topics such as X Factor judge Tulisa’s infamous sex tape, how to palm off the gift of a free sex toy to a friend and the dichotomy of ‘entertainer vs artist’. Oh and, more importantly, which Spice Girl is the nicest. To download the exclusive extended version of this podcast head over to http://www.comedycentral.co.uk/podcasts

Episode 20: Stewart Lee Comedy Central Stewart Lee is this month’s guest on Robin and Josie’s Utter Shambles and the subject of choice this month: alternative vs. mainstream comedy. Stewart Lee is this month’s guest on Robin and Josie’s Utter Shambles and the subject of choice this month: alternative vs. mainstream comedy. In his third appearance on the podcast, Stewart talks Michael McIntyre, Russell Brand and finally getting around to watching Seinfeld for the first time.
